alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 28 at 7:58PM CDT until March 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER LIKELY/POSSIBLE TUESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 006, 007, 017, 018, 019, 085 AND 086... * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 006 Smith, Fire Weather Zone 007 Jewell, Fire Weather Zone 017 Rooks, Fire Weather Zone 018 Osborne and Fire Weather Zone 019 Mitchell. In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 085 Webster and Fire Weather Zone 086 Nuckolls. * WINDS...From the south-southwest 20 to 30 MPH with gusts 35 to 45 MPH. * TIMING...1 PM to 8PM Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could lead to fire ignition. In addition, if any fires remain active after sunset, they will be impacted by a significant wind shift to northerly behind a cold front.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
